abstract: Some current advertisers would not meet the new standards announced by the entertainment giant on Tuesday.
snippet: Some current advertisers would not meet the new standards announced by the entertainment giant on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — The Walt Disney Company, in an effort to address concerns about entertainment’s role in childhood obesity, announced on Tuesday that all products advertised on its child-focused television channels, radio stations and Web sites must comply with a strict new set of nutritional standards.

headline.main: Promoting Nutrition, Disney to Restrict Junk-Food Ads
headline.print_headline: Promoting Nutrition, Disney to Restrict Junk-Food Ads

abstract: Apple will go in a different direction from Google Maps, and a D.J.’s comment makes for unhappy Nicki Minaj fans.
snippet: Apple will go in a different direction from Google Maps, and a D.J.’s comment makes for unhappy Nicki Minaj fans.
lead_paragraph: At a Washington news conference with the first lady, Michelle Obama, the Walt Disney Company on Tuesday plans to announce new nutritional standards for advertisers on its many child-focused outlets, including the Saturday morning cartoons on the ABC stations it owns. The standards would disqualify a wide range of candy, sugared cereal and fast food from advertising, Brooks Barnes writes. Also, Disney will reduce the amount of sodium by 25 percent in the children’s meals served at its theme parks, and create public service announcements to promote exercise and healthy eating.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Disney’s Health Push, and Eerie Numbers in China
